alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Coastal Areas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 12 at 1:10PM PST until January 15 at 10:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST SUNDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM FRIDAY TO 10 PM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 6 to 8 feet through Sunday. Sets of 10 to 12 feet possible in San Diego County Friday and Saturday. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding possible along the San Diego County coast Friday and Saturday, especially during high tide. * WHERE...San Diego County Coastal Areas. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 10 PM PST Sunday. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 10 AM Friday to 10 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide of 3.54 ft at 1210 PM Friday and 4.08 ft at 213 AM Saturday.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
